oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hygienic Practices Affecting Milk Quality and Mastitis on Larger Dairies
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bushnell, Robert B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hygiene
milking
milking-parlor sanitation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hygiene as practiced on the modern dairy plays a primary role in the production of high-quality milk and in reducing the incidence of the mastitic infections which are the major disease threat to dairy profits. For practical purposes, milking-parlor sanitation must be separated into three phases:I. premilking sanitation2. cleansing of the milking unit after each cow is milked, and reducing organisms on the milker's hands.3. dipping teats in an effective germicide post-milking.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1984; 115-118
